Numerical (picmol.models.numerical)¶

class picmol.models.numerical.QuarticModel(z_data, Hmix_data, SE_data, molar_vol, z=None, gid_type='vol')[source]¶

A class for modeling excess thermodynamic properties using a 4th order Taylor series expansion (\(A^E\)).

This class fits a polynomial to enthalpy of mixing (Hmix_data) and excess entropy (SE_data) experimental data. It then uses this fit to calculate various thermodynamic properties.

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} A^{E} = &-\sum_{i=1}^{N-1}\sum_{j=1}^{N} \left[a_{ii} + \cdots + a_{ii\cdots i}\right]x_ix_j \\ &+ \sum_{i=1}^{N-1}\sum_{j=1}^{N-1} a_{ij}x_ix_j \\ &+ \sum_{i=1}^{N-1}\sum_{\le j}^{N-1}\sum_{\le k}^{N-1} a_{ijk}x_ix_jx_k \\ &+ \sum_{i=1}^{N-1}\sum_{\le j}^{N-1}\sum_{\le k}^{N-1}\sum_{\le l}^{N-1} a_{ijkl}x_ix_jx_kx_l \end{align}\end{split}\]

where:

  • \(x_i\) are mol fractions of component \(i\)

  • \(a_{ij\ldots}\) are fitting parameters

Parameters:

  • z_data (numpy.ndarray) – array of mol fraction data for experimental data

  • Hmix_data (numpy.ndarray) – enthalpy of mixing data

  • SE_data (numpy.ndarray) – excess entropy data

  • molar_vol (list) – list of molar volumes

  • z (numpy.ndarray, optional) – mol fraction data. Defaults to None.

  • gid_type (str, optional) – type of excess Gibbs energy calculation. Defaults to vol.

fit_Hmix()[source]¶

Fits the Taylor series expansion, \(A^E\), to Hmix_data.

This method uses the curve_fit function from SciPy to determine the optimal parameters for the quartic function that best fits the provided Hmix_data. The fitted parameters are stored in the Hmix_params attribute.

Returns:

mixing enthalpy parameters for \(A^E\)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

fit_SE()[source]¶

Fits the Taylor series expansion, \(A^E\), to SE_data.

This method uses the curve_fit function from SciPy to determine the optimal parameters for the quartic function that best fits the provided SE_data. The fitted parameters are stored in the SE_params attribute.

Returns:

excess entropy parameters for \(A^E\)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Hmix()[source]¶

Evaluates Taylor series expansion, \(A^E\), for mixing enthalpy, \(\Delta H_{mix}\), over large composition space.

Returns:

enthalpy of mixing

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

SE()[source]¶

Evaluates Taylor series expansion, \(A^E\), for excess entropy, \(S^E\), over large composition space.

Returns:

excess entropy

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Gid(T)[source]¶

Calculates the ideal Gibbs mixing free energy.

\[\frac{G^{id}}{RT} = \sum_i x_i \ln{\left(x_i\right)}\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

array of calculated Gibbs ideal mixing free energy values

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dGid_dxs(T)[source]¶

Calculates the first derivative of Gibbs ideal mixing free energy with respect to composition.

\[\frac{1}{RT}\frac{\partial G^{id}}{\partial x_i} = \ln(x_i) - \ln\left(1 - \sum_{j=1}^{n-1} x_j\right)\]

for (i = 1, 2, …, n-1).

Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

array containing the first derivatives of Gid() with respect to each component’s mole fraction.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

d2Gid_dx2s(T)[source]¶

Calculates the second derivative of Gibbs ideal mixing free energy with respect to composition.

\[\begin{split}\frac{1}{RT}\frac{\partial^2 G^{id}}{\partial x_i \partial x_j} = \begin{align} \begin{cases} &\frac{1}{x_i} + \frac{1}{1 - \sum_{k=1}^{n-1} x_k}, & \text{if } i = j \\ &\frac{1}{1 - \sum_{k=1}^{n-1} x_k}, & \text{if } i \ne j \end{cases} \end{align}\end{split}\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

array containing the second derivatives of Gid() with respect to the mole fractions of each pair of components.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

gammas(T)[source]¶

Calculates the activity coefficients by differentiating excess Gibbs energy, \(G^E\), with respect to mol fraction.

\[RT \ln \gamma_i = \frac{\partial N G^E}{\partial N_i}\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

array of the activity coefficients for each component as a function of composition.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

GE(T)[source]¶

Calculates the excess Gibbs energy.

\[G^E = \Delta H_{mix} - T S^E\]

which is equivalent to:

\[G^E = RT \sum_i x_i \ln{\gamma_i}\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

excess Gibbs energy values.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

GM(T)[source]¶

Calculates the Gibbs mixing free energy.

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} \Delta G_{mix} &= G^E + G^{id} \\ &= \Delta H_{mix} - T S^E + RT \sum_i x_i \ln{\left(x_i\right)} \end{align}\end{split}\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

Gibbs mixing free energy values.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dGM_dxs(T)[source]¶

Calculates the first derivative of Gibbs mixing free energy by differentiating excess molar properties (Hmix() and SE()) defined by \(A^E\), with respect to the mol fractions using SymPy.

Note

This function uses SymPy to perform symbolic differentiation of the excess molar property equation. This ensures that the derivatives are exact. The partial derivative of \(A^E\) is taken with respect to each mol fraction \(x_i\).

Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

first derivative of \(\Delta G_{mix}\) with respect to \(x\) evaluated at temperature (T)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

d2GM_dx2s(T)[source]¶

Calculates the second derivative of Gibbs mixing free energy by differentiating excess molar properties (Hmix() and SE()) defined by \(A^E\), with respect to the mol fractions using SymPy.

Note

This function uses SymPy to perform symbolic differentiation of the excess molar property equation. This ensures that the derivatives are exact. The partial second derivative of \(A^E\) is taken with respect to mol fractions \(x_i\) and \(x_j\).

Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

second derivative of \(\Delta G_{mix}\) with respect \(x\) evaluated at temperature (T)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

det_Hij(T)[source]¶

Calculates the determinant of the Hessian matrix of \(\Delta G_{mix}\).

Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

The determinant of the Hessian matrix of the second derivatives of the excess Gibbs free energy with respect to composition.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray
